member.name: T:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice
member.summary:
Gripper arm device class
The gripper arm device is a complex device representing a robot arm with a gripper Y/Z device.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_GripArm
A gripper arm has a X Motor and at least one gripper Y/Z module, with Y-, Z-, Gripper- and rotation motors. \n
The item handling is done by the \ref SHandlingMethods "handling methods" subclass.
%SGripArmDevice class diagram
\image html "SGripArmDevice.png"
member.remarks: In general the gripper arm is provided to support more then one gripper Y/Z device. As we never had a device like this yet, this is not tested!

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice.#ctor
member.summary:
Default constructor
This constructor creates a device with all configuration members to its default values.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
XML string configuration constructor
This constructor creates a device by parsing the device parameters from the given XML configuration string.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice.#ctor(Sias.RobotDev.SArmDeviceFlags,System.Double,Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice,System.Double,System.Int32,Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDeviceCollection,Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods)
member.summary: Manual generation constructor This constructor creates a device by using the given parameters.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary: Initialize the gripper arm. This initializes also all sub devices of the arm.
member.param: This should allow initialize only parts, but is not supported yet. To keep applications compatible with older versions it is recommended to pass 0xFFFFFFFF for the init options. This forces an initialization of the complete arm.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice.YZDevices
member.summary: Array with all connected Gripper Y/Z Devices.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice.Handling
member.summary: Handling methods and parameters property

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripArmDevice.DeviceName
member.summary:
Name of the Arm device
Changing the name of the arm device results in changing the names of all connected sub devices.

member.name: T:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice
member.summary:
Gripper Y/Z device class.
The gripper Y/Z device is a complex device representing the part of the gripper arm connected to the Y traverse.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_GripArm
It includes Y-, Z-, Gripper- and rotation motors. \n
The gripper Y/Z device is derived from a standard Y/Z device. In addition to the Y/Z device members the gripper Y/Z class implements - ... .
%SGripArmDevice class diagram
\image html "SGripYZDevice.png"
member.remarks: The Gripper Y/Z device move methods will not take care about the Gripper tool X and Y offsets, but it cares about the Z offset. This is important for the travel height!

member.name: T:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice
M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.CheckZRange(System.Double)
member.summary: This method checks and optionally limits the Z range without giving an error. In case of changing the position a warning is logged.
member.returns: Optionally limited absolute destination worktable position

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.ZWorktablePos(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate Z desk position from a given Z motor position

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.ZMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate Z motor position from a given Z desk position

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.PrepareZMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.YWorktablePos(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate Y desk position from a given Y motor position

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.YMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate Y motor position from a given Y desk position

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.PrepareYMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Y motor move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.RMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert rotation worktable coordinate to a rotation motor position.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.RWorktablePos(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert a rotation motor position to a rotation worktable coordinate.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert gripper worktable coordinate to a gripper motor position.

member.summary: Convert a gripper motor position to a gripper worktable coordinate.

member.summary: Move gripper R motor to a rotation worktable coordinate.

member.summary: Move Gripper G motor to a Gripper worktable coordinate.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.CloseGripper(System.Double)
member.summary: Close handler. The method closes the handler. An upcoming error will be ignored.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.OpenGripper(System.Double)
member.summary: Open handler. The method opens the handler. An upcoming error will be ignored.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.PlateCheck(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Plate check. The method checks if the handler finds a plate. If finding a plate the method returns the optimal close value else it returns the open value.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.ZFactor
member.summary: Z motor rescaling factor. This factor allows to rescale the Z motor positions. Normally this is only used to revert the motor.

member.summary: Z Offset

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.ZMax
member.summary: Maximum Z motor move range [mm].

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.TravelSafetyMargin
member.summary:
Safety margin for travel calculations.
This property defines a safety margin for the Y/Z device. This safety margin is a circle around the middle of the Y/Z device which can be covered by the Y/Z device. It is used to calculate an extended move rectangle for calculating the travel height.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.RMax
member.summary: This property defines the maximum angle in worktable coordinates

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.RInitOffset
member.summary: Rotate motor init offset property. The Rotate motor init offset is used after init the rotate motor, but before reinit the Z motor and init the Y motor.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.RMotor
member.summary: Rotation motor

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.RFactor
member.summary: Rotation motor scaling factor property.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.ROffset
member.summary: Rotation motor scaling offset property.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GMax
member.summary: This property defines the maximum angle in worktable coordinates

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GMotor
member.summary: Gripper motor field.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GFactor
member.summary: Gripper motor scaling factor property.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GOffset
member.summary: Gripper motor scaling offset property.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GInitOffset
member.summary:
Gripper motor init offset property.
The gripper motor init offset is used before gripper init to optionally open the gripper. This shoucan drop an available item before init the gripper. \n
member.remarks: Note: Initializing the gripper motor with an gripped item would result in incorrect gripper motor positions!

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GripCheckOffset
member.summary: Grip check offset property. This offset defines the additional close offset to check if the gripping was successfully or not. It needs to be high enough to get the motor blocked.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.GripperTool
member.summary:
Actual gripper tool property.
This property defines the actual gripper tool, mostly this gripper tool is fix connected to the gripper Y/Z device. Typically the gripper tool will change/define the position offsets for gripping components. As the gripper tool can also pick other gripper tools this may again change the position offsets.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.DeviceName
member.summary: Device name

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.YRange_Min
member.summary: Minimum reachable Y worktable position for this Y/Z device

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.YRange_Max
member.summary: Maximum reachable Y worktable position for this Y/Z device

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.YSafetyMargin
member.summary:
Y safety margin property (virtual)
This property is used to define a Y safety margin for other tips. Depending on the Y/Z device condition it may be that it neighbors need to keep a higher distance as the origin init offset. As long as this feature is not needed the Value can be left to 0.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.YWorktablePosition
member.summary:
Y worktable position from device.
This property returns the last known Y motor position as worktable coordinates.

member.summary: Minimum reachable Z worktable position for this Y/Z device

member.summary: Maximum reachable Z worktable position for this Y/Z device

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.IGripYZDevice.ZWorktablePosition
member.summary:
Z Worktable position from device.
This property returns the last known Z motor position as worktable coordinates.

member.summary: Maximum reachable G worktable position for this Y/Z device.

member.summary: Current item property. This property gets/sets the current item gripped with this gripper Y/Z device. If no item is gripped the property should be (set to) null.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.GetErrorInfos
member.summary: This interface function returns the default error messages which can be generated by this device.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Init gripper Y/Z device.
This first calls the base initialization method initializing the Z, X and Y motor. Then it initializes the gripper and rotation motor.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare travel move. This method checks if a travel move is needed and if so, it prepares the travel move. Then the execution group of all concerned modules will be returned to be used in an external execute call.
member.returns: Execution group of the prepared modules, 0 if no move needed

member.summary: Calculate Z desk position from a given Z motor position.

member.summary: Calculate Z motor position from a given Z desk position.

member.summary: Convert rotation worktable coordinate to a rotation motor position.

member.summary: Convert a rotation motor position to a rotation worktable coordinate.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.PrepareRMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move gripper R motor to a rotation worktable coordinate.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: RMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.PrepareGMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move Gripper G motor to a Gripper worktable coordinate.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.CloseGripper(System.Double)
member.summary:
Close handler.
The method closes the handler. An upcoming error will be ignored.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.OpenGripper(System.Double)
member.summary: Open handler. The method opens the handler. An upcoming error will be ignored.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.PlateCheck(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Plate check.
The method checks if the handler finds a plate. If finding a plate the method returns the optimal close value otherwise it returns the open value.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.AddArmMethods(Sias.BaseDev.SBaseArmMethodsCollection,Sias.BaseDev.SBaseArmDevice)
member.summary: Add supported arm methods to given arm method collection a collection.
member.remarks: Take care each arm should not have each method block more then once!
member.returns: A collection of all supported arm method blocks

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.XRotateOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Additional X-Offset (typically coming from gripper tool offsets) depending on the gripper rotation.
member.returns: The X-Offset for the given rotation

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripYZDevice.YRotateOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Additional Y-Offset (typically coming from gripper tool offsets) depending on the gripper rotation.
member.returns: The Y-Offset for the given rotation

member.name: T:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool
member.summary:
Gripper tool class
The gripper tools class contains the configuration properties and position translation calculations of gripper tools. It is used by gripper arms or gripper Y/Z devices.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_GripArm
- ... . ToDo: Document details of the gripper tool class including the Gripper offsets with a simple image.
%SGripArmDevice class diagram
\image html "SGripperTool.png"

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.TranslatedGripperPosition(Sias.Core.SGripperPosition)
member.summary:
Translate gripper coordinates to gripper tool coordinates.
This method translates coordinates. That means it recognizes the additional offsets needed so that the gripper tool reference point is at the position defined by the gripper coordinates.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.CfgXOffset
member.summary:
X-Offset property.
This offset defines the X distance between the middle of the Gripper tool and the rotation point of the gripper at an angle of 0°

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.CfgYOffset
member.summary:
Y-Offset property.
This offset defines the Y distance between the middle of the Gripper tool and the rotation point of the gripper at an angle of 0°

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.CfgZOffset
member.summary:
Z-Offset property.
This offset defines the height correction between the bottom of the Gripper tool and the bottom the gripper.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.CfgRotateOffset
member.summary:
Rotate Offset property.
This offset defines an rotation offset between the gripper tool and the gripper.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.CfgGripOffset
member.summary:
Grip Offset property.
This offset defines an grip offset between the gripper tool and the gripper.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.SubGripperTool
member.summary: Sub gripper tool property. This property defines a sub gripper tool. That means a gripper tool picked by the actual gripper tool. As the sub gripper tool can have another sub gripper tools, you can define complete tool chains.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SGripperTool.XOffset
member.summary: X-Offset optionally including the sub gripper tool offsets

member.name: T:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods
member.summary:
Handling methods class.
This class contains the item handling methods. Typically this methods will be wrapped by the arm using them. That means an arm which is able to do item handling typically has a reference to handling methods class.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_GripArm
To make the item handling methods working, the connected arms needs to have at least one gripper Y/Z device implementing the \nlink{Sias,GripArm.IGripYZDevice} interface.
The item handling methods class implements - a method to select the gripper Y/Z device (mostly not needed); - a method with the special init needs for gripper Y/Z devices; - low level methods for Z movements based on gripper or tool reference; - low level methods for opening, closing the gripper; - a low level plate check method - high level methods for getting and putting items; - a high level methods for moving items and - a high level method for moving an item with incubation start\n This will start an internal timer after the item is placed at the destination slot. When trying to get the item it will first wit until the timer is elapsed. .
The handling methods can not be used if not connected to an arm device including at least one valid gripping Y/Z device.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.#ctor
member.summary:
Default constructor
This constructor creates a device with all configuration members to its default values.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.#ctor(Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice)
member.summary: Manual generation constructor This constructor creates a device by using the given parameters.

member.name: F:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods._YZDev
member.summary: Current selected Y/Z device field

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.GetErrorInfos
member.summary: This interface function returns the default error messages which can be generated by this device.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.SelectGripper(System.Int32)
member.summary: Select the active gripper. This function selects one of the available gripper Y/Z devices as active gripper Y/Z device.
member.remarks: - No collision checks concerning other Y/Z devices are implemented now. - The new selected gripper is using the same gripper tool. Mostly the gripper tool needs to be changed also if another gripper gets connected. - As we do not have a gripper arm with more the one Y/Z devices, the whole Gripper Y/Z device selection stuff is mostly untested! .
member.returns: true if selection successful, false if not initialized Gripper arm

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Initialize an arm including gripper Y/Z devices.
This initializes also all sub devices of the arm.
member.param: The Init option is used to restrict initialization
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MoveZ(System.Double)
member.summary: Move Gripper to Z height. Take care, this does not consider any Gripper tool offsets.
member.param: New Z position of the gripper
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: YZDev.ZMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MoveToolZ(System.Double)
member.summary:
Move Gripper tool to Z height.
This method moves the gripper tool to the specified position. This considers also the gripper tool offsets.
member.param: New Z position of the gripper tool
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: YZDev.ZMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.PrepareYMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Prepare Y Motors
Prepare all Y motor to allow the selected gripper Y/Z device moving to the defined destination
member.returns: The execution group of all prepared modules

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MoveGripper(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Move Gripper to new position.
This method moves the selected gripper to the specified position. For the Z movement it supports three different modes depending on the current and the given Z position: - negative Z: Make gripper move at travel height given from layout. - Z above ZMotor.Pos: Execute Z move before gripper move - Z below ZMotor.Pos: Execute gripper move before Z move . This guarantees always a movement at the highest possible Z value.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour
\b Important: This method will change the arm priority to be locked. Take care to release the arm priority if the tasked you have to do on the defined destination is finished.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MoveGripper(Sias.Core.SGripperPosition,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Move Gripper to new position.
This method moves the selected gripper to the specified position. For the Z movement it supports three different modes depending on the current and the given Z position: - negative Z: Make gripper move at travel height given from layout. - Z above ZMotor.Pos: Execute Z move before gripper move - Z below ZMotor.Pos: Execute gripper move before Z move . The real movement will be done by \code MoveGripper(GrpPos.X, GrpPos.Y, GrpPos.Orientation, GrpPos.Z, Slow); \endcode IMPORTANT: The speed definition in the gripper position options will be ignored if slow is defined (greater then 0)
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour
\b Important: This method will change the arm priority to be locked. Take care to release the arm priority if the tasked you have to do on the defined destination is finished.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MoveGripperTool(Sias.Core.SGripperPosition,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Move Gripper to new position.
This method moves the selected gripper to the defined gripper tool position. Depending on the gripper options the movement will be done either on maximum height, on travel height or on a specific Z position. This method is identical to MoveGripper(GrpPos, Slow) expect that it considers the current tool offsets in addition. The real movement will be done by \code MoveGripper(YZDev.GripperTool.TranslatedGripperPosition(GrpPos), Slow); \endcode IMPORTANT: The speed definition in the gripper position options will be ignored if slow is defined (greater then 0)
member.param: New Gripper tool position (including move options)

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.CloseGripper(System.Double)
member.summary: Close gripper to requested close value.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: YZDev.GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.CloseGripper
member.summary: Close gripper to the current items gripper close position.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: YZDev.GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.OpenGripper(System.Double)
member.summary: Open gripper to requested open value.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: YZDev.GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.OpenGripper
member.summary: Open gripper to the current items gripper open position.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: YZDev.GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.PlateCheck(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Check for available plate (item).
The method checks if the handler finds a plate. If finding a plate the method returns the optimal close value else it returns the open value. \n This method calls IGripYZDevice.PlateCheck. \n It considers the gripper tools grip offset!
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: YZDev.GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.PreCheckSlot(Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Prepare the slot for loading / unloading.
This method prepares a slot for loading or unloading. Therefore it waits until the slot timer is elapsed. Then it requests access from the slot. \n As the slot requests access from all connected components, this also gives access to any concerned device.
member.param: Maximum timeout to get access (excluding slot timer times)

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.PostCheckSlot(Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot)
member.summary:
Post check slot.
This method releases transfer access at the given slot.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.GetGripperPath(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem)
member.summary: Get gripper path from current item and translate it to a gripper tool compatible gripper path.
member.returns: Gripper path of the given Item

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MoveGripperPath(Sias.Core.SGripperPositionCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Move gripper along a given gripper path.
The method is based on the current item of the active Y/Z device.
member.param: true = to position, false = from position
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour
\b Important: This method will change the arm priority to be locked. Take care to release the arm priority if the tasked you have to do on the defined destination is finished.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.GetItem(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,System.Int32)
member.summary:
This method gets an item from its current slot. The method tries to get access to the source slot (Item.CurrentSlot). If the access is not guaranteed within the defined timeout a RE_NO_ACCESS error will be generated.
\b Important: The current slot will not be changed/removed. This needs to be done at the calling method.
member.param: The item to get from its (former defined) current slot
member.remarks: The arm gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour
The arm priority gets locked and restored in this method.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.PutItem(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,System.Int32)
member.summary:
This method puts an item to the current slot.
The method tries to get access to the destination slot (Item.CurrentSlot). If the access is not guaranteed within the defined timeout a RE_NO_ACCESS error will be generated.
Important: The items current slot property needs to be set before the method is called.
member.param: The item to put on its (former defined) current slot
member.remarks: The arm gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour
The arm priority gets locked and restored in this method.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MoveItem(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method moves an item to a new slot.
member.remarks: The arm gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour
The arm priority gets locked and restored in this method.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.Incubate(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method moves an item to a new slot and set the incubation timer of the new slot.
member.param: Access timeout (maximum wait time to get access to the item slots) [ms]

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.YZDev
member.summary: Current selected Y/Z device (\b see \nlink{Sias::GripArm,SHandlingMethods.SelectGripper})

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.MethodsSupported
member.summary:
Method supported property
This property is used to verify the method block. In case of the gripper arm handling methods it verifies if the arm is valid and at least one gripper Y/Z device is available.
member.value: True if execution possible otherwise false

member.name: T:Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods.ErrorCodes
member.summary: This static class keeps the error code constants of the \ref Sias::GripArm::SHandlingMethods errors.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.InitRequired(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary: Check if the default execution group gives an init request with the given init options.
member.returns: True if we have to init, false if not

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Init Y/Z device.
Initialization sequence: \n - init Z motor (this move it up) - init Y motors
member.param: This should allow the Initialization only parts, but is not supported yet. To keep applications compatible with older versions it is recommended to pass 0xFFFFFFFF for the init options. This forces an Initialization of the complete arm.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.PrepareRelativeYMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare relative Y motor move. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Relative Y position in worktable coordinates [mm]

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor travel move if necessary. This method makes sure, that the Z motor moves at least to the defined travel height. If the Z motor is above the defined travel height it will not move.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.PrepareRelativeZMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare relative Z motor move. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Relative Z position in worktable coordinates [mm]

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.PrepareZScanMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor scan move to an absolute worktable position. The scan move gets the submerge way after detection. As we have no way to have an acceleration on addition this will always use the modules default acceleration! Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.PrepareZBlockMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor block move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Block mode, this defines the moving force. In a normal configured system that means 1=strong, 2=middle, 3=weak

member.name: M:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.SetLDSensitivity(System.Byte)
member.summary: Set liquid detector sensitivity mode. The standard liquid detection systems have 4 different sensitivities. - 1 - sensitivity for fixed tips in tubes - 2 - sensitivity for fixed tips in MTPs - 3 - sensitivity for disposable tips in tubes - 4 - sensitivity for disposable tips in MTPs . Of course this sensitivities modes may be different on non standard robots.
member.returns: True if the new sensitivity mode was accepted

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.DefaultExecutionGroup
member.summary: Default execution group for the Y/Z device property

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.YFactor
member.summary: Y motor rescaling factor. This factor allows to rescale the Y motor positions. Normally this is only used to revert the motor.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.YMax
member.summary: Maximum Y motor move range [mm].

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.DeviceState
member.summary: Get state of the YZ Device and all of its known sub devices

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.BaseFlags
member.summary: Get the base flags of the YZ Device including all of its sub devices

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.ExecutionGroup
member.summary:
Execution group property.
This property can be used to get/set the execution group of all sub devices of the Arm. Setting the execution group results in the same execution group for all sub devices. Getting it will result in a binary of all sub device execution groups.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.YWorktablePositionFromDevice
member.summary:
Z worktable position from device.
This property requests the current motor position from the Z motor device and translates it to worktable coordinates.

member.name: P:Sias.GripArm._unused_IGripYZDevice.ZWorktablePositionFromDevice
member.summary:
Z Worktable position from device.
This property requests the current motor position from the Z motor device and translates it to worktable coordinates.
